1.text: He that loveth correction, loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is foolish.

2.text: He that is good, shall draw grace from the Lord : but he that trusteth in his own devices doth wickedly.

3.text: Men shall not be strengthened by wickedness: and the root of the just shall not be moved.

4.text: A diligent woman is a crown to her husband: and she that doth things worthy of confusion, is a rottenness in his bones.

5.text: The thoughts of the just are judgments: and the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.

6.text: The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood: the mouth of the just shall deliver them.

7.text: Turn the wicked, and they shall not be: but the house of the just shall stand firm.

8.text: A man shall be known by his learning: but he that is vain and foolish, shall be exposed to contempt.

9.text: Better is the poor man that provideth for himself, than he that is glorious and wanteth bread.

10.text: The just regardeth the lives of his beasts: but the bowels of the wicked are cruel.

11.text: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that pursueth idleness is very foolish. He that is delighted in passing his time over wine, leaveth a reproach in his strong holds.

12.text: The desire of the wicked is the fortification of evil men: but the root of the just shall prosper.

13.text: For the sins of the lips ruin draweth nigh to the evil mall: but the just shall escape out of distress.

14.text: By the fruit of his own mouth shall a man be filled with good things, and according to the works of his hands it shall be repaid him.

15.text: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that is wise hearkeneth unto counsels.

16.text: A fool immediately sheweth his anger: but he that dissembleth injuries is wise.

17.text: He that speaketh that which he knoweth, sheweth forth justice: but he that lieth, is a deceitful witness.

18.text: There is that promiseth, and is pricked as it were with a sword of conscience: but the tongue of the wise is health.

19.text: The lip of truth shall be steadfast for ever: but he that is a hasty witness, frameth a lying tongue.

20.text: Deceit is in the heart of them that think evil things: but joy followeth them that take counsels of peace.

21.text: Whatsoever shall befall the just man. it shall not make him sad: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.

22.text: Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord: but they that deal faithfully please him.

23.text: A cautious man concealeth knowledge: and the heart of fools publisheth folly.

24.text: The hand of the valiant shall bear rule: but that which is slothful, shall be under tribute.

25.text: Grief in the heart of a man shall bring him low, but with a good word he shall be made glad.

26.text: He that neglecteth a loss for the sake of a friend, is just: but the way of the wicked shall deceive them.

27.text: The deceitful man shall not find gain: but the substance of a just man shall be precious gold.

28.text: In the path of justice is life: but the by-way leadeth to death.
